required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Post Marketing Surveillance For General Drug Use To Assess the Safety And Efficacy Profile Of Viviant In Usual Practice
clinical_study.official_title: Post Marketing Surveillance For General Drug Use To Assess The Safety And Efficacy Profile Of Viviant In Usual Practice.

brief_summary.textblock: This survey is conducted for preparing application material for re examination under the Pharmaceutical Affairs Laws and its Enforcement Regulation, and assessing the safety and efficacy profiles of VIVIANT in usual practice according to the Re-examination Regulation for New Drugs

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 28 days after last dose of Viviant 20 mg (up to 6 months)
primary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent are events between first dose of study drug and up to 28 days after last dose of Viviant 20 mg tablet, that were absent before treatment or that worsened relative to pre-treatment state. AEs included both serious and non-serious adverse events.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Related Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs), Serious ADRs, and Unexpected ADRs
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 28 days after last dose of Viviant 20 mg (up to 6 months)
primary_outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. AEs included both serious and non-serious AEs. All AEs, except for those with causal relationship to the study drug assessed as "unlikely" or "no", were considered as ADRs. Unexpected AEs/ADRs were classified by medical review with reference to the local product document and confirmed by Pfizer. Treatment related ADRs included all ADRs with causality related to treatment as judged by the investigator.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Efficacy Evaluation of Viviant 20 mg Tablet
secondary_outcome.description: Efficacy evaluation of Viviant 20 mg tablet was carried out on the basis of the assessment of clinical response by the treating physician. Clinical response among participants were assessed by the physician as improved, no change, worsened and unevaluable for efficacy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Osteoporosis Related Fractures
Number of Participants With Abnormal Dual Energy X-Ray Absorptiometry (DXA)
secondary_outcome.description: DXA is established standard for measuring bone mineral density. Criteria for abnormality was based on investigator's discretion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal X-ray Result
secondary_outcome.description: Criteria for abnormality was based on investigator's discretion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Bone Mineral Density Result
secondary_outcome.description: A bone mineral density test examines segments of bone through X-rays to detect osteoporosis. Criteria for abnormality was based on investigator's discretion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Biochemical Markers of Bone Turnover
secondary_outcome.description: In this study biochemical markers of bone turnover included C-telopeptide of collagen cross links (CTX), osteocalcin and bone specific alkaline phosphatase. Criteria for abnormality was based on investigator's discretion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Postmenopausal osteoporosis and osteopenia patients
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with active or past history of venous thromboembolic events including deep vein thrombosis,
- Patients with pulmonary embolism and retinal vein thrombosis

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Viviant Tablet 20 mg
group.description: Participants who received Viviant tablet 20 milligram (mg) once daily orally as a part of routine clinical practice for the first time, were observed for up to a maximum of 6 months. The dose and frequency of Viviant tablet was according to the treating physician as per the approved product labelling.

baseline.population: Safety analysis set included all participants who received Viviant 20 mg tablet at least once and completed the follow up.

group.title: Viviant Tablet 20 mg
group.description: Participants who received Viviant tablet 20 milligram (mg) once daily orally as a part of routine clinical practice for the first time, were observed for up to a maximum of 6 months. The dose and frequency of Viviant tablet was according to the treating physician as per the approved product labelling.

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent are events between first dose of study drug and up to 28 days after last dose of Viviant 20 mg tablet, that were absent before treatment or that worsened relative to pre-treatment state. AEs included both serious and non-serious adverse events.

outcome.population: Safety analysis set included all participants who received Viviant 20 mg tablet at least once and completed the follow up.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
measure.description: An AE was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. An SAE was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. Treatment-emergent are events between first dose of study drug and up to 28 days after last dose of Viviant 20 mg tablet, that were absent before treatment or that worsened relative to pre-treatment state. outcome.title: Overall Efficacy Evaluation of Viviant 20 mg Tablet
outcome.description: Efficacy evaluation of Viviant 20 mg tablet was carried out on the basis of the assessment of clinical response by the treating physician. Clinical response among participants were assessed by the physician as improved, no change, worsened and unevaluable for efficacy.
outcome.population: Efficacy analysis set included all participants who received Viviant 20 mg tablet at least once and completed evaluation of efficacy endpoints at least once.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Abnormal Biochemical Markers of Bone Turnover
outcome.description: In this study biochemical markers of bone turnover included C-telopeptide of collagen cross links (CTX), osteocalcin and bone specific alkaline phosphatase. Criteria for abnormality was based on investigator's discretion.

reported_events.time_frame: Baseline up to 28 days after last dose of Viviant 20 mg tablet (up to 6 months)
reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one participant and as non serious in another participant, or one participant may have experienced both a serious and non serious event during the study.

group.title: Viviant Tablet 20 mg
group.description: Participants who received Viviant tablet 20 milligram (mg) once daily orally as a part of routine clinical practice for the first time, were observed for up to a maximum of 6 months. The dose and frequency of Viviant tablet was according to the treating physician as per the approved product labelling.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
